title: England close in on last 16 with win over Denmark
title_page: England close in on last 16 with win over Denmark - BBC Sport
maintext:
England are on the brink of last 16 qualification in the Women's World Cup after producing a much-improved performance to beat Denmark 1-0.
Lauren James announced herself on the global stage with a superb strike from the edge of the box just six minutes into her first World Cup start, and it proved to be the deciding goal in Sydney.
However, a serious looking injury to Barcelona midfielder Keira Walsh dampened what was a positive, attacking performance from the Lionesses.
Denmark almost found an equaliser when substitute Amalie Vangsgaard - who scored a 90th-minute winner over China - headed a cross against the post.
England will be through to the last 16 if China fail to beat Haiti in the other Group D match, kicking off at 12:00 BST, while Denmark face Haiti in their final group match and can still qualify.
